div.p: On FOIA.gov, you'll find the data contained in the annual reports
submitted by federal departments and agencies to the Department of Justice.
These reports contain a detailed look at the numbers of requests received,
how they were handled by the agency, as well as information on processing times,
backlogs, fees and the personnel needs to comply with the FOIA.
Within each of these categories, there are different data sets that can be explored through FOIA.gov.
For example, you can run reports to find out how many FOIA requests were received by a particular agency,
to learn how many times different agencies used a particular FOIA exemption,
or to compare the average processing times for FOIA requests across multiple agencies.
You can use the available FOIA data can to generate
new reports and comparisons across agencies and over time.
